greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, read by rows, where row n lists the coefficients of x^k, k=1..2^n, in the n-th iteration of (x + x^2) for n>=0.
comment: T(n, k) is the number of strings of length k-1 on the alphabet {1, 2, ..., n} such that between every two occurrences of a letter i there is an occurrence of a letter strictly larger than i. For example, for n = 3, k = 4 we have the strings 121, 131, 232 and the six permutations of 123. - _Joel B. Lewis_, May 06 2008
link: Paul D. Hanna, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2046 (rows 0..10)
Art of Problem Solving forum, Strings on [n] with certain restrictions.
formula: T(n,k) = [x^k] F_n(x) where F_{n+1}(x) = F_n(x+x^2) for n>=1, with F_0(x)=x.
example: Multiplying the g.f. of column k by (1-x)^k, k>=1, with leading zeros,
yields the g.f. of row k in the triangle A122890:
in which the main diagonal is the Catalan numbers
and the row sums form the factorials.
maple: T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=1..degree(p)))(b(n)):
mathematica: f[0][x_] = x; f[n_][x_] := f[n][x] = f[n-1][x+x^2]; row[n_] := CoefficientList[f[n][x], x] // Rest; Table[row[n], {n, 0, 5} ] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 10 2012 *)
program: (PARI) {T(n,k)=local(F=x+x^2, G=x+x*O(x^k)); if(n<0, 0, for(i=1, n, G=subst(F, x, G)); return(polcoeff(G, k, x)))}
(Maxima) T(m,n):=if m=0 and n=1 then 1 else if m=0 and n>1 then 0 else  if m=1 then binomial(1,n-1) else sum(binomial(i,n-i)*T(m-1,i),i,1,n); [_Vladimir Kruchinin_, May 19 2012]
xref: Cf. A007018 (row sums), diagonals: A112317, A112319, A122887; A092123 (largest term in row); A122889 (antidiagonal sums); A122890 (related triangle).
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Sep 18 2006
